name: Erythrokeratodermia Variabilis et Progressiva (EKVP)
chief_complaint: My skin keeps getting thick, red patches that come and go, and it's spreading to new areas.
physical_findings: Lesions with variable morphology over time
prognosis: Chronic condition with variable progression; lesions may stabilize in adulthood but rarely resolve completely
description: EKVP is a rare genodermatosis characterized by two distinct features: (1) transient, migratory erythematous patches (erythrokeratodermia variabilis) and (2) fixed hyperkeratotic plaques (progressiva). It results from connexin gene mutations affecting gap junction function in keratinocytes. The condition typically presents in infancy or early childhood and shows autosomal dominant inheritance with complete penetrance but variable expressivity.
